metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7617 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Remote code execution can occur in Asterisk Open Source 13.x before 13.14.1 and 14.x before 14.3.1 and Certified Asterisk 13.13 before 13.13-cert3 because of a buffer overflow in a CDR user field, related to X-ClientCode in chan_sip, the CDR dialplan function, and the AMI Monitor action. Alex Villacis Lasso discovered that asterisk did not properly check the length of certain input. A remote attacker could use this vulnerability to cause a denial of service (crash) or potentially execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7617` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

asterisk - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-config - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-dahdi - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-mobile - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-modules - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-mp3 - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-mysql - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-ooh323 - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-tests - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-voicemail - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-voicemail-imapstorage - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-voicemail-odbcstorage - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
asterisk-vpb - 1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: asterisk package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:13.18.3~dfsg-1ubuntu4').
